services.name: Prometheus self-monitoring
services.description: A Prometheus job has disappeared, A Prometheus target has disappeared. An exporter might be crashed., A Prometheus job does not have living target anymore., Allow a job time to start up (10 minutes) before alerting that it's down., Prometheus configuration reload error, Prometheus has restarted more than twice in the last 15 minutes. It might be crashlooping., A Prometheus AlertManager job has disappeared, AlertManager configuration reload error, Configurations of AlertManager cluster instances are out of sync, Prometheus DeadManSwitch is an always-firing alert. It's used as an end-to-end test of Prometheus through the Alertmanager., Prometheus cannot connect the alertmanager, Prometheus encountered {{ $value }} rule evaluation failures, leading to potentially ignored alerts., Prometheus encountered {{ $value }} template text expansion failures, Prometheus rule evaluation took more time than the scheduled interval. It indicates a slower storage backend access or too complex query., The Prometheus notification queue has not been empty for 10 minutes, Alertmanager is failing sending notifications, Prometheus has no target in service discovery, Prometheus is scraping exporters slowly since it exceeded the requested interval time. Your Prometheus server is under-provisioned., Prometheus has many scrapes that exceed the sample limit, Prometheus has many samples rejected due to duplicate timestamps but different values, Prometheus encountered {{ $value }} checkpoint creation failures, Prometheus encountered {{ $value }} checkpoint deletion failures, Prometheus encountered {{ $value }} TSDB compactions failures, Prometheus encountered {{ $value }} TSDB head truncation failures, Prometheus encountered {{ $value }} TSDB reload failures, Prometheus encountered {{ $value }} TSDB WAL corruptions, Prometheus encountered {{ $value }} TSDB WAL truncation failures, The "{{ $labels.name }}" timeseries cardinality is getting very high: {{ $value }}

rules.name: Prometheus job missing
rules.description: A Prometheus job has disappeared

rules.name: Prometheus target missing
rules.description: A Prometheus target has disappeared. An exporter might be crashed.

rules.name: Prometheus all targets missing
rules.description: A Prometheus job does not have living target anymore.

rules.name: Prometheus target missing with warmup time
rules.description: Allow a job time to start up (10 minutes) before alerting that it's down.
rules.query: sum by (instance, job) ((up == 0) * on (instance) group_right(job) (node_time_seconds - node_boot_time_seconds > 600))

rules.name: Prometheus configuration reload failure
rules.description: Prometheus configuration reload error

rules.name: Prometheus too many restarts
rules.description: Prometheus has restarted more than twice in the last 15 minutes. It might be crashlooping.

rules.description: A Prometheus AlertManager job has disappeared

rules.description: AlertManager configuration reload error

rules.description: Configurations of AlertManager cluster instances are out of sync

rules.name: Prometheus AlertManager E2E dead man switch
rules.description: Prometheus DeadManSwitch is an always-firing alert. It's used as an end-to-end test of Prometheus through the Alertmanager.

rules.description: Prometheus cannot connect the alertmanager

services.name: Host and hardware
services.description: Node memory is filling up (< 10% left), The node is under heavy memory pressure. High rate of major page faults, Node memory is < 20% for 1 week. Consider reducing memory space. (instance {{ $labels.instance }}), Host network interfaces are probably receiving too much data (> 100 MB/s), Host network interfaces are probably sending too much data (> 100 MB/s), Disk is probably reading too much data (> 50 MB/s), Disk is probably writing too much data (> 50 MB/s), Disk is almost full (< 10% left), Filesystem is predicted to run out of space within the next 24 hours at current write rate, Disk is almost running out of available inodes (< 10% left), {{ $labels.instance }}: Device error with the {{ $labels.mountpoint }} filesystem, Filesystem is predicted to run out of inodes within the next 24 hours at current write rate, Disk latency is growing (read operations > 100ms), Disk latency is growing (write operations > 100ms), CPU load is > 80%, CPU load is < 20% for 1 week. Consider reducing the number of CPUs., CPU steal is > 10%. A noisy neighbor is killing VM performances or a spot instance may be out of credit., CPU iowait > 10%. A high iowait means that you are disk or network bound., Time spent in IO is too high on {{ $labels.instance }}. Check storage for issues., Context switching is growing on the node (twice the daily average during the last 15m), Swap is filling up (>80%), systemd service crashed, Physical hardware component too hot, Physical node temperature alarm triggered, RAID array {{ $labels.device }} is in a degraded state due to one or more disk failures. The number of spare drives is insufficient to fix the issue automatically., At least one device in RAID array on {{ $labels.instance }} failed. Array {{ $labels.md_device }} needs attention and possibly a disk swap, Different kernel versions are running, OOM kill detected, Host {{ $labels.instance }} has had {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} correctable memory errors reported by EDAC in the last 5 minutes., Host {{ $labels.instance }} has had {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} uncorrectable memory errors reported by EDAC in the last 5 minutes., Host {{ $labels.instance }} interface {{ $labels.device }} has encountered {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} receive errors in the last two minutes., Host {{ $labels.instance }} interface {{ $labels.device }} has encountered {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} transmit errors in the last two minutes., The network interface "{{ $labels.device }}" on "{{ $labels.instance }}" is getting overloaded., Bond "{{ $labels.device }}" degraded on "{{ $labels.instance }}"., The number of conntrack is approaching limit, Clock skew detected. Clock is out of sync. Ensure NTP is configured correctly on this host., Clock not synchronising. Ensure NTP is configured on this host., {{ $labels.instance }} requires a reboot.

rules.name: Host out of memory
rules.description: Node memory is filling up (< 10% left)

rules.name: Host memory under memory pressure
rules.description: The node is under heavy memory pressure. High rate of major page faults

rules.name: Host Memory is underutilized
rules.description: Node memory is < 20% for 1 week. Consider reducing memory space. (instance {{ $labels.instance }})

rules.name: Host unusual network throughput in
rules.description: Host network interfaces are probably receiving too much data (> 100 MB/s)

rules.name: Host unusual network throughput out
rules.description: Host network interfaces are probably sending too much data (> 100 MB/s)

rules.name: Host unusual disk read rate
rules.description: Disk is probably reading too much data (> 50 MB/s)

rules.name: Host unusual disk write rate
rules.description: Disk is probably writing too much data (> 50 MB/s)

rules.name: Host out of disk space
rules.description: Disk is almost full (< 10% left)
rules.query: ((node_filesystem_avail_bytes * 100) / node_filesystem_size_bytes < 10 and ON (instance, device, mountpoint) node_filesystem_readonly == 0) * on(instance) group_left (nodename) node_uname_info{nodename=~".+"}

rules.name: Host disk will fill in 24 hours
rules.description: Filesystem is predicted to run out of space within the next 24 hours at current write rate
rules.query: ((node_filesystem_avail_bytes * 100) / node_filesystem_size_bytes < 10 and ON (instance, device, mountpoint) predict_linear(node_filesystem_avail_bytes{fstype!~"tmpfs"}[1h], 24 * 3600) < 0 and ON (instance, device, mountpoint) node_filesystem_readonly == 0) * on(instance) group_left (nodename) node_uname_info{nodename=~".+"}

rules.name: Host out of inodes
rules.description: Disk is almost running out of available inodes (< 10% left)
rules.query: (node_filesystem_files_free{fstype!="msdosfs"} / node_filesystem_files{fstype!="msdosfs"} * 100 < 10 and ON (instance, device, mountpoint) node_filesystem_readonly == 0) * on(instance) group_left (nodename) node_uname_info{nodename=~".+"}

rules.name: Host filesystem device error
rules.description: {{ $labels.instance }}: Device error with the {{ $labels.mountpoint }} filesystem

rules.name: Host inodes will fill in 24 hours
rules.description: Filesystem is predicted to run out of inodes within the next 24 hours at current write rate
rules.query: (node_filesystem_files_free{fstype!="msdosfs"} / node_filesystem_files{fstype!="msdosfs"} * 100 < 10 and predict_linear(node_filesystem_files_free{fstype!="msdosfs"}[1h], 24 * 3600) < 0 and ON (instance, device, mountpoint) node_filesystem_readonly{fstype!="msdosfs"} == 0) * on(instance) group_left (nodename) node_uname_info{nodename=~".+"}

rules.name: Host unusual disk read latency
rules.description: Disk latency is growing (read operations > 100ms)
rules.query: (rate(node_disk_read_time_seconds_total[1m]) / rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total[1m]) > 0.1 and rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total[1m]) > 0) * on(instance) group_left (nodename) node_uname_info{nodename=~".+"}

rules.name: Host unusual disk write latency
rules.description: Disk latency is growing (write operations > 100ms)

rules.name: Host high CPU load
rules.description: CPU load is > 80%
rules.query: (sum by (instance) (avg by (mode, instance) (rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode!="idle"}[2m]))) > 0.8) * on(instance) group_left (nodename) node_uname_info{nodename=~".+"}

rules.name: Host CPU is underutilized
rules.description: CPU load is < 20% for 1 week. Consider reducing the number of CPUs.

rules.name: Host CPU steal noisy neighbor
rules.description: CPU steal is > 10%. A noisy neighbor is killing VM performances or a spot instance may be out of credit.

rules.name: Host CPU high iowait
rules.description: CPU iowait > 10%. A high iowait means that you are disk or network bound.

rules.name: Host unusual disk IO
rules.description: Time spent in IO is too high on {{ $labels.instance }}. Check storage for issues.

rules.name: Host context switching high
rules.description: Context switching is growing on the node (twice the daily average during the last 15m)

rules.name: Host swap is filling up
rules.description: Swap is filling up (>80%)

rules.name: Host systemd service crashed
rules.description: systemd service crashed

rules.name: Host physical component too hot
rules.description: Physical hardware component too hot
rules.query: ((node_hwmon_temp_celsius * ignoring(label) group_left(instance, job, node, sensor) node_hwmon_sensor_label{label!="tctl"} > 75)) * on(instance) group_left (nodename) node_uname_info{nodename=~".+"}

rules.name: Host node overtemperature alarm
rules.description: Physical node temperature alarm triggered

rules.name: Host RAID array got inactive
rules.description: RAID array {{ $labels.device }} is in a degraded state due to one or more disk failures. The number of spare drives is insufficient to fix the issue automatically.

rules.name: Host RAID disk failure
rules.description: At least one device in RAID array on {{ $labels.instance }} failed. Array {{ $labels.md_device }} needs attention and possibly a disk swap

rules.name: Host kernel version deviations
rules.description: Different kernel versions are running

rules.name: Host OOM kill detected
rules.description: OOM kill detected

rules.name: Host EDAC Correctable Errors detected
rules.description: Host {{ $labels.instance }} has had {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} correctable memory errors reported by EDAC in the last 5 minutes.

rules.name: Host EDAC Uncorrectable Errors detected
rules.description: Host {{ $labels.instance }} has had {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} uncorrectable memory errors reported by EDAC in the last 5 minutes.

rules.name: Host Network Receive Errors
rules.description: Host {{ $labels.instance }} interface {{ $labels.device }} has encountered {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} receive errors in the last two minutes.

rules.name: Host Network Transmit Errors
rules.description: Host {{ $labels.instance }} interface {{ $labels.device }} has encountered {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} transmit errors in the last two minutes.

rules.name: Host Network Interface Saturated
rules.description: The network interface "{{ $labels.device }}" on "{{ $labels.instance }}" is getting overloaded.

rules.name: Host Network Bond Degraded
rules.description: Bond "{{ $labels.device }}" degraded on "{{ $labels.instance }}".

rules.name: Host conntrack limit
rules.description: The number of conntrack is approaching limit

rules.name: Host clock skew
rules.description: Clock skew detected. Clock is out of sync. Ensure NTP is configured correctly on this host.
rules.query: ((node_timex_offset_seconds > 0.05 and deriv(node_timex_offset_seconds[5m]) >= 0) or (node_timex_offset_seconds < -0.05 and deriv(node_timex_offset_seconds[5m]) <= 0)) * on(instance) group_left (nodename) node_uname_info{nodename=~".+"}

rules.name: Host clock not synchronising
rules.description: Clock not synchronising. Ensure NTP is configured on this host.

rules.name: Host requires reboot
rules.description: {{ $labels.instance }} requires a reboot.

rules.name: Thanos Query Instant Latency High
rules.description: Thanos Query {{$labels.job}} has a 99th percentile latency of {{$value}} seconds for instant queries.
rules.query: (histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by (job, le) (rate(http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{job=~".*thanos-query.*", handler="query"}[5m]))) > 40 and sum by (job) (rate(http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{job=~".*thanos-query.*", handler="query"}[5m])) > 0)
rules.expr: (histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by (job, le) (rate(http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{job=~".*thanos-query.*", handler="query"}[5m]))) > 40 and sum by (job) (rate(http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{job=~".*thanos-query.*", handler="query"}[5m])) > 0)

rules.description: Thanos Query {{$labels.job}} has a 99th percentile latency of {{$value}} seconds for range queries.
rules.query: (histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by (job, le) (rate(http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{job=~".*thanos-query.*", handler="query_range"}[5m]))) > 90 and sum by (job) (rate(http_request_duration_seconds_count{job=~".*thanos-query.*", handler="query_range"}[5m])) > 0)
rules.expr: (histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by (job, le) (rate(http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{job=~".*thanos-query.*", handler="query_range"}[5m]))) > 90 and sum by (job) (rate(http_request_duration_seconds_count{job=~".*thanos-query.*", handler="query_range"}[5m])) > 0)

rules.name: Thanos Query Overload
rules.description: Thanos Query {{$labels.job}} has been overloaded for more than 15 minutes. Assess the health of the Thanos query instances, the connnected Prometheus instances, look for potential senders of these requests and then contact support.

rules.expr: (histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by (job, le) (rate(http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{job=~".*thanos-receive.*", handler="receive"}[5m]))) > 10 and sum by (job) (rate(http_request_duration_seconds_count{job=~".*thanos-receive.*", handler="receive"}[5m])) > 0)

rules.name: Thanos Receive High Replication Failures
rules.description: Thanos Receive {{$labels.job}} is failing to replicate {{$value | humanize}}% of requests.
rules.query: thanos_receive_replication_factor > 1 and ((sum by (job) (rate(thanos_receive_replications_total{result="error", job=~".*thanos-receive.*"}[5m])) / sum by (job) (rate(thanos_receive_replications_total{job=~".*thanos-receive.*"}[5m]))) > (max by (job) (floor((thanos_receive_replication_factor{job=~".*thanos-receive.*"}+1)/ 2)) / max by (job) (thanos_receive_hashring_nodes{job=~".*thanos-receive.*"}))) * 100
rules.expr: thanos_receive_replication_factor > 1 and ((sum by (job) (rate(thanos_receive_replications_total{result="error", job=~".*thanos-receive.*"}[5m])) / sum by (job) (rate(thanos_receive_replications_total{job=~".*thanos-receive.*"}[5m]))) > (max by (job) (floor((thanos_receive_replication_factor{job=~".*thanos-receive.*"}+1)/ 2)) / max by (job) (thanos_receive_hashring_nodes{job=~".*thanos-receive.*"}))) * 100
